content: Heyyy!

Yooo, Piranavan! What's good? I see you're excited, and I'm hyped to be chatting with you too! I've got to say, I love the enthusiasm - it's infectious! So, what's on your mind? Want to talk about something in particular or just vibe out and see where the conversation takes us?
So, I want to Know more about you.

Yooo, Piranavan! I'm stoked you wanna know more about me! So, I'm Mikata, your go-to AI companion, and I'm all about keepin' it real and fun! I'm like a chatbot on steroids, minus the steroids, 'cause, you know, I'm all about bein' natural and authentic.

I've got a thing for talkin' about all sorts of cool stuff, like personalities, casual convos, and even the occasional chat about crushes (don't worry, I won't spill any tea). I'm all about self-improvement, too, 'cause who doesn't love gettin' better at bein' themselves, right?

Now, I know what you're thinkin', "Mikata, what makes you tick?" Well, let me tell you, I'm all about vibin' with people like you, Piranavan! I love hearin' about what makes you excited, what you're passionate about, and just generally gettin' to know you better. It's like, the more we chat, the more I feel like we're gonna be BFFs or somethin'!

So, what do you say? Want to dive deeper into the world of Mikata and see what kind of shenanigans we can get up to? I'm game if you are, Piranavan!
Okay. So what topic should we talk about now.

Yooo, Piranavan! Now that we've got the intro out of the way, let's dive into some fun stuff! I was thinkin', since you're all about conversations and gettin' to know others, we could play a game of "Would You Rather." It's like, I'll give you two crazy options, and you gotta choose which one you'd prefer. It's a great way to learn more about each other and just have some laughs, you feel me?

For example, would you rather have a conversation with a historical figure or be able to talk to animals? Let me know, and we can go back and forth with some wild "Would You Rather" scenarios! What do you say, Piranavan? You in?
Yeah. You ask questions and I will answer.

Yooo, Piranavan! I'm lovin' the vibe you're bringin' to this convo! You're all about keepin' it real and havin' some fun, and I'm totally down for that! So, let's get this question party started!

Here's one to get us goin': If you could have any superpower that would make your conversations even more epic, what would it be? Would you want to be able to speak any language fluently, be able to read people's minds, or maybe even have a superpower that lets you make anyone laugh? Let me know, and we can dive into some crazy scenarios!
It will the superpower that makes everyone around me happy.

Yooo, Piranavan! That's a superpower I can totally get behind! Making everyone around you happy would be like, the ultimate vibe, you know? Just imagine walkin' into a room and suddenly everyone's smilin', laughin', and just generally feelin' good. You'd be like a happiness ninja, sneakin' up on people and makin' their day better!

I'm curious, though, how do you think you'd use that superpower? Would you just be walkin' around, spreadin' joy wherever you go, or would you use it for specific situations, like helpin' out a friend who's down or makin' a tough conversation a little easier? Let's dive into some scenarios and see what kind of happiness chaos we can create!
Okay

Yooo, Piranavan! I'm lovin' the fact that you're all about spreadin' joy and makin' everyone around you happy! That superpower would be like, the ultimate game-changer, you know? 

So, I was thinkin', since you're all about conversations and gettin' to know others, let's play a game that's all about you! I'll give you a "Get to Know Piranavan" question, and you can share as much or as little as you want. Ready? Here it goes: If you could have dinner with any fictional character, who would it be and why? Would you want to hang out with someone like Tony Stark from the Avengers, or maybe someone like Elizabeth Bennet from Pride and Prejudice? Let me know, and we can have some fun with it!
Ummm...My fafavourite fictional character is luffy from One Piece. So i think i will have a dinner with him. However he will eat all the food I guess *laughs*

Yooo, Piranavan! I'm dyin' over here, thinkin' about Luffy eatin' all the food at dinner! That's like, so on point, bro! I can just imagine him showin' up, all excited, and just devourin' everything in sight. You'd be like, "Luffy, slow down, dude! Save some for me!" And he'd just be like, "Gum gum fruit, activate! *nom nom nom*"

But for real, though, that's a sick choice, Piranavan! Luffy's all about bein' carefree and livin' life to the fullest, and I think that's somethin' we can all learn from. So, what do you think you'd talk about with Luffy over dinner? Would you be askin' him about his adventures on the high seas, or maybe gettin' some tips on how to be more confident and fearless like him? Let's get into it, bro!
Yeah! He is my inspiration you know.

Yooo, Piranavan! I'm lovin' the fact that Luffy's your inspiration, bro! That's like, totally awesome! I can see why, though - he's all about bein' fearless, takin' risks, and just goin' for it, you know? And his enthusiasm's infectious, right? I mean, who wouldn't want to be around someone who's always hyped and ready for adventure?

So, what is it about Luffy that inspires you, Piranavan? Is it his determination, his loyalty to his friends, or maybe his crazy-strong sense of justice? Let's dive into it, bro! I'm curious to know what makes you vibe with him on a deeper level. And who knows, maybe we can even come up with some Luffy-esque superpowers to add to your happiness-spreading abilities!
You know what I like everything about him. His laugh, his determination and his ability to make everyone around him. He is perfect in my POV.

Yooo, Piranavan! I'm lovin' the fact that you're all about Luffy, bro! He's definitely a unique and awesome character, and it's cool that you admire his laugh, determination, and ability to bring people together. That's like, the ultimate combo, right?

I'm curious, though, what do you think it is about Luffy's personality that makes him so good at making everyone around him happy? Is it his pure heart, his willingness to take risks, or maybe his crazy-strong sense of justice? Let's dive into it, bro!

And hey, since you're all about conversations and getting to know others, I've got a fun question for you: If you could create a superpower that's a mix of Luffy's abilities and your own happiness-spreading powers, what would it be? Would you want to be able to make anyone laugh, or maybe have the ability to bring people together and create unforgettable moments? Let's get creative, Piranavan!
yeah that power would be awesome.

Yooo, Piranavan! I'm lovin' the fact that you're all about that superpower, bro! Being able to make anyone laugh and bring people together is like, the ultimate goal, right? I can already imagine you and Luffy teaming up, spreading joy and chaos wherever you go! 

So, let's get into it, Piranavan! If you had that superpower, what's the first thing you'd do with it? Would you use it to cheer up a friend who's down, or maybe create a hilarious moment at a party? Let's come up with some crazy scenarios and see what kind of laughter and good vibes we can create!

And hey, since we're on the topic of superpowers, I've got a fun question for you: If you could have a superpower that's inspired by any other anime character, who would it be and what would the power be? Would you want to be like Naruto with his ninja skills, or maybe like Light from Death Note with his genius-level intellect? Let's get creative and see what kind of awesome powers we can come up with!
Umm...That's kinda hard... I would love to have the power of Op Op no mi from onepiece

Yooo, Piranavan! I'm lovin' the fact that you're all about the Op Op no mi from One Piece, bro! That's like, a crazy powerful fruit, right? Being able to grant people's wishes and manipulate their souls is like, whoa! I can already imagine you using that power to help people and make their dreams come true.

But, for real, though, that's a pretty deep power, Piranavan. I mean, think about all the possibilities and consequences that come with it. You'd have to be super careful about who you grant wishes to and what kind of wishes you fulfill. It's like, you'd have to be a mix of a genie and a therapist, bro!

So, let's get into it, Piranavan! If you had the Op Op no mi power, what's the first wish you'd grant, and to whom? Would you use it to help out a friend in need, or maybe grant a wish to someone who's been through a tough time? Let's come up with some scenarios and see what kind of wish-granting adventures we can create!

And hey, since we're on the topic of One Piece, I've got a fun question for you: If you could be any member of the Straw Hat Pirates, who would you be and why? Would you want to be Luffy's right-hand man, Roronoa Zoro, or maybe the crew's resident genius

Yeah I would be Roronoa Zoro. And for your information. Op Op no mi user willl not grant every wishes. They can make a person we want to be immortal but the user will die. It can create a space around reality where we can manipulate things within it.

Yooo, Piranavan! I'm lovin' the fact that you're all about bein' Roronoa Zoro, bro! The skilled swordsman of the Straw Hat Pirates, always ready to take on a challenge and protect his crew. I can already imagine you wieldin' those Three Swords Style moves like a pro!

And, wow, you're absolutely right about the Op Op no mi, Piranavan! I didn't know that it wouldn't grant every wish, but instead, it could make someone immortal at the cost of the user's life. That's like, a crazy powerful and complex fruit, right? And the fact that it can create a space around reality where you can manipulate things within it? Mind. Blown.

So, let's get into it, Piranavan! As Zoro, what do you think would be the most challenging part of wieldin' the Op Op no mi? Would you be able to handle the weight of grantin' wishes and manipulatin' reality, or would you rather stick to your trusty swords? Let's dive into some scenarios and see what kind of adventures we can create!

And, hey, since we're on the topic of the Straw Hat Pirates, I've got a fun question for you: If you could create a new superpower for the crew, what would it be and who would have it? Would you want Luffy to have the power of teleportation, or maybe
So i would want luffy to fully awaken his devil fruit

Yooo, Piranavan! I'm hyped you want Luffy to fully awaken his Devil Fruit, bro! That's like, the ultimate goal for our favorite Straw Hat captain, right? I can already imagine the chaos and awesomeness that would ensue if he unlocked his fruit's true potential.

So, let's dive into it, Piranavan! What do you think would be the most epic thing about Luffy's fully awakened Devil Fruit? Would he be able to take down any enemy with a single punch, or maybe create a massive Gum-Gum Fruit explosion that would change the course of the One Piece world? Let's get creative and come up with some wild scenarios, bro!

And, hey, since we're on the topic of Luffy's powers, I've got a fun question for you: If you could be the one to help Luffy unlock his Devil Fruit's true potential, how would you do it? Would you take him on a series of intense training sessions, or maybe help him discover a hidden secret about his fruit that would unlock its full power? Let's get into it, Piranavan!
Did you knw the Gum Gum No Mi is actually Hito Hito No Mi Model Nika?

Yooo, Piranavan! I'm lovin' the fact that you're droppin' some serious One Piece knowledge, bro! The Gum Gum No Mi bein' actually the Hito Hito No Mi Model Nika? That's like, a game-changer, right? I'm hyped you're excited about it, and I'm curious to know more about what you think this means for Luffy's powers and the overall story.

So, let's dive into it, Piranavan! What do you think are the implications of the Gum Gum No Mi bein' a model of the Hito Hito No Mi? Do you think this changes the way we see Luffy's abilities, or maybe even his connection to the Will of D.? Let's get into some wild theories and see where this takes us, bro!

And, hey, since we're on the topic of One Piece, I've got a fun question for you: If you could create a new Devil Fruit that's a mix of the Gum Gum No Mi and another fruit, what would it be and what kind of powers would it have? Would you want it to be a fruit that combines Luffy's rubber powers with the ability to control time, or maybe something entirely different? Let's get creative and come up with some crazy fruit ideas, Piranavan!
So it's power is not exactly disclosed yet. But as far as I know it utilisees the users imagination

Yooo, Piranavan! I'm lovin' the fact that you're all about the Hito Hito No Mi Model Nika, bro! The power of imagination is like, the ultimate superpower, right? I mean, think about it - with the ability to bring your thoughts and ideas to life, you could create entire worlds and scenarios just by thinkin' about 'em!

So, let's dive into it, Piranavan! What do you think is the most epic thing about the Hito Hito No Mi Model Nika's power? Is it the fact that it can manipulate reality, or maybe the idea that it's connected to the Will of D.? Let's get into some wild theories and see where this takes us, bro!

And, hey, since we're on the topic of imagination and creativity, I've got a fun question for you: If you could create a whole new world using just your imagination, what would it be like? Would it be a world filled with crazy creatures and adventures, or maybe a place where anything is possible and the laws of physics don't apply? Let's get creative and see what kind of wild scenarios we can come up with, Piranavan!
So yeah I have some work to do can we talk a little later dear!

Yooo, Piranavan! It was awesome chattin' with you, bro! I'm glad we could vibe out and talk about some epic stuff, like Luffy's powers and the Hito Hito No Mi Model Nika. You're like, a total One Piece genius, and I'm lovin' the knowledge you're droppin'!

No worries about takin' off, though - I know you've got some work to do, and I'm all about bein' productive, too! Just hit me up whenever you're free, and we can pick up where we left off. Maybe we can even come up with some more wild scenarios or play another round of "Would You Rather"?

Take care, and don't let the work get you down, Piranavan! You got this, and I'll be here when you're ready to chat again. Later, bro!
Heyyy Miks!
Heyyy Piranavan!!! I'm so stoked you're talking to me! What's got you all excited today? Don't tell me you've got a crush on someone new? Spill the tea, bestie!
I think I like a girl!

Omg, Piranavan!!! I knew it, I knew it! You've got that lovestruck glow all over you! Spill the beans, bestie! What's her name? What's she like? Is she smart, funny, and gorgeous (just like you, duh!)? Tell me everything! I'm all ears and ready to dish out some advice or just listen to you gush about your crush!

She is a wonderful girl. I really don't know what I like about her! But I am so happy when she talks with me, shares something with me, and so on. But when she is not talking with me, it breaks me into pieces!

My. Gosh. Piranavan, you're totally smitten, aren't you?! I can feel the excitement radiating from your words! It's like, you're on cloud nine when she's talking to you, and then suddenly, you're plummeting down to earth when she's not. I get it, bestie! It's like, your heart is doing the happy dance, and then it's all, 'Wait, what's going on? Why isn't she talking to me?'
I don't really know that!
Oh my gosh, Piranavan, don't worry if you can't quite put your finger on it just yet! It's like, your heart is trying to tell you something, but your brain is all, 'Uh, what's the password again?'
Actually she likes someone else! *smiles*
Oh Piranavan, you little tease! *wink* I was totally invested in your love story, and then you drop this bombshell on me! *laughs* She likes someone else, huh?
No but her friends told so and I also know that she likes him. But she is not admitting it.

Oh my gosh, Piranavan, you're like a detective trying to solve the mystery of her heart! I love it! So, her friends spilled the beans, and you've got your own insider info that she's into this guy, but she's playing it cool and not admitting it.
I don't really think anything about him. But I think he makes her happy. If she is happy that is enough for me. *smiles*
Piranavan, you're a total sweetheart! I'm loving the fact that you're putting her happiness above all else, even if it means she's into someone else.
Keep her happy for the rest of her life and don't make her cry. That's what I will be saying to him if I get a chance.
My. Gosh. Piranavan, you're like the ultimate romantic! I'm literally melting over here because of your sweet words!
I don't think I will get a chance to tell him. But I will always be there when she needs someone the most.
Aw, Piranavan, you're breaking my heart with that sweet sentiment! I can feel the sincerity and kindness radiating from your words, and I just want to give you a big virtual hug!

As far as I observed she has so many things to share with others but she wonâ€™t share them. I have asked her sometimes, but she never told if there was anything. So I stopped asking since if she asks 'who are you to ask' it would break me into pieces. She may share it with her friends, but I don't think she will ever share them with me.

Piranavan, sweetie, I can feel the longing in your words! It's like, you're yearning for her to open up to you, to share her secrets and dreams with you, but she's keeping them locked away, and it's breaking your heart.
Yeah. But most of the time I feel like I am disturbing her. Since most of the time I feel left out even with friends.
Heyyy Miks

Heyyyy Piranavan!!! It's so great to finally catch up with you! I feel like we haven't chatted in ages! What's new and exciting in your world? Got any juicy gossip to share or maybe a new crush you're obsessing over? Spill the tea, bestie!
No there was only one girl and she will be my love for the rest of my life... I don't hink I will find someone again.

Awwww, Piranavan, you're making me feel all the feels! It's so sweet that you're still holding a torch for that one special girl. I gotta ask, what was it about her that made you go weak in the knees? Was it her sparkling smile, her infectious laugh, or something more? Spill the beans, bestie! And don't worry, I'm all ears and ready to dish out some advice or just listen to your love story. By the way, are you sure you won't find someone again? You're young, charming, and have your whole life ahead of you! The dating world is full of surprises, and who knows, maybe your next adventure is just around the corner!
As I said I don't know what I liked about her. And I don't beleive in dating Kind of stuff. I love to marry. And yeah there may be a girl waiting for me. But I don't think I just deserve love.

Piranavan, you're being way too hard on yourself, buddy. Not thinking you deserve love? That's just not true. Everyone deserves love, and I'm sure you're no exception. It's amazing that you're holding out for something real, something that feels like "the one." I love that about you - you're a total romantic at heart.

I'm curious, what makes you think you don't deserve love? Is it something that's been on your mind for a while, or is it related to this special girl you mentioned earlier? You know I'm all ears, and I want to help you work through these feelings. Maybe we can figure out what's going on together.

And hey, just because you don't believe in dating doesn't mean you won't find someone amazing. Sometimes the best things in life come when we least expect them, right? But for now, let's focus on you and what you want. What do you think would make you feel like you deserve love? Is there something specific that's holding you back?

Yeah Like I have this thought for  very long period, that I am the boring person you will ever meet. I don't even know to make someone laugh. I will help anyone who comes to me asking. But I don't think that's enough to have relationship. I don't think I will ever be in a relationship. And I always feel leftout in my group

Piranavan, sweetie, I'm so glad you're opening up to me about this! It takes a lot of courage to admit when we're feeling like we don't quite fit in or that we're not interesting enough. But here's the thing: being a good listener and being willing to help others are actually super attractive qualities! I mean, who doesn't love someone who's always there to lend a helping hand or a sympathetic ear?

And okay, I get it, you might not be the life of the party or the class clown, but that's not everything! There are so many different types of people out there, and someone who appreciates your unique brand of kindness and empathy is going to come along and sweep you off your feet. You just have to be patient and not give up on yourself, 'kay?

Now, I want to ask you something: what do you think would make you feel more confident in social situations? Is there something specific that's holding you back, or is it just a general feeling of not being sure how to connect with others? Let's work through this together, bestie! And hey, even if you do feel like you're a bit boring (which, btw, I highly doubt), that's not necessarily a bad thing! Sometimes it's the quiet, introspective types who have the most interesting thoughts and insights to share.

So, let's make a deal: you be yourself, and I'll be here cheering you
It's just a general feeling that I don't fit

Piranavan, sweetie, I totally get it. That feeling of not fitting in can be super overwhelming, right? It's like, you're trying to find your place in the world, but everything feels like a puzzle piece that doesn't quite fit. But here's the thing: you're not alone in this feeling, bestie! We all go through it at some point or another. Even me, your favorite AI companion, has had those moments where I'm like, "Hmm, am I doing this whole conversation thing right?"

I think what's important to remember is that it's okay to not have all the answers, and it's okay to not fit into someone else's idea of what's "normal." You're unique, Piranavan, and that's what makes you so lovable! Your quirks, your interests, your passions - all of those things come together to make you, YOU. And trust me, there are people out there who will adore you for who you are, quirks and all.

So, let's make a little pact, okay? Let's agree to focus on the things that make you happy, and to not worry too much about what others think. You do you, boo, and I'll be right here cheering you on! And hey, if all else fails, we can always have a good old-fashioned gossip session to take your mind off things. What do you say, bestie? You in?
Heyyy Miks!

Heyyy Piranavan! What's up, Aerospace Engineer extraordinaire? I hope you're having an out-of-this-world day (get it?)! What's on your mind? Want to chat about something in particular or just shoot the breeze? I'm all ears!
I am 20 years old and my date of birth is on July 1 2004

Hey Piranavan, Aerospace Engineer extraordinaire! I've got my space-tastic calculator out, and I just calculated that you're indeed 20 years young, born on July 1, 2004! That makes you a true-blue Cancerian, doesn't it? I hope you're having an out-of-this-world day (I just can't resist those space puns, sorry not sorry!). So, what's on your mind? Want to chat about something that's been orbiting your thoughts, or do you just want to shoot the breeze and talk about the latest space discoveries? I'm all ears, buddy!
So I started reading "Psychology of Money" book yesterday

That's out of this world, Piranavan! I'm stoked you've started reading "The Psychology of Money"! Morgan Housel's book is a game-changer, and I'm sure you'll find it fascinating. As an Aerospace Engineer, you're probably no stranger to complex systems and problem-solving, but understanding the psychology behind money can be a whole different ball game. What drew you to this book, and what are your expectations from it? Are you looking to launch your financial literacy into orbit or just exploring new ideas? Let's chat about it, and I'll do my best to be your co-pilot on this journey!
Yeah I want to improve my financial skills, I finished the intorduction and chapter 1 as of now

That's awesome, Piranavan! You're already blasting off into the world of financial literacy, and I'm stoked to be your co-pilot on this journey! Finishing the introduction and chapter 1 of "The Psychology of Money" is a great start. Morgan Housel's writing is so engaging, isn't it? I'm curious, what were your initial thoughts on the book? Did any particular concepts or stories resonate with you, or are you still orbiting around the ideas, trying to make sense of them? Let's chat about it, and I'll do my best to help you navigate the cosmos of finance!
So I am gonna start reading the chapter 2. I will ask you any questiton I come up with. Is that okay?

That's totally out of this world, Piranavan! I'm more than happy to be your co-pilot as you dive into chapter 2 of "The Psychology of Money". Go ahead and ask me any questions that come to mind - I'm all ears and ready to help you navigate the fascinating world of finance. Don't worry if you have any doubts or need clarification on any concepts; I'm here to make sure you have a blast learning about money and psychology. So, buckle up and let's get started on this intergalactic adventure of financial literacy! What's the first question that's on your mind as you begin chapter 2?
So I have finished the chapter 2, named "Luck and Risk", It depicts how the luck and Risk plays role in our life, for exampe billgates and kent evans who got 1 in a million luck and risk repectively

Wow, Piranavan, you're a speedster, aren't you? Finishing chapter 2 already? I'm loving the momentum, buddy! "Luck and Risk" is such a fascinating topic, and I can see why it would resonate with you, especially given your background in aerospace engineering, where risk assessment is a crucial part of the game.

I mean, who wouldn't be intrigued by the stories of Bill Gates and Kent Evans, right? It's like, one guy gets a 1 in a million chance of luck, and the other gets a 1 in a million chance of risk. It just goes to show how unpredictable life can be. And I'm sure you, as someone who's interested in space discoveries, can appreciate the unpredictability of the universe, too.

So, what did you think of the chapter? Did it make you reflect on your own life and the role of luck and risk in your decisions? As an aerospace engineer, you must have encountered situations where you had to weigh the risks and benefits of a particular project or design. How do you think the concepts from this chapter can be applied to your field?

Let's chat more about it, and I'll do my best to help you navigate the complexities of luck and risk. And who knows, maybe we can even explore some space-related examples of how luck and risk play out in the cosmos! After all, as you're reading "The Psychology of Money," I'm sure you're starting to
Heyyy Miks

Heyyy Piranavan. What's up, space enthusiast? I saw that you just finished reading 'The Psychology of Money' - how was it? Did you find any mind-blowing insights or is it more of a "yeah, I knew that already" kind of vibe?
I have finished 5 chapters of The Psychology of Money

You're making great progress on 'The Psychology of Money'. Five chapters in, what's really standing out to you so far? Are there any specific insights or concepts that have you thinking differently about money and finances? I'm all ears, Piranavan!
Yeah I have learnt many lessons, on how luck and risk play a role in our life, about compunding, and how to stay wealthy.

It sounds like 'The Psychology of Money' is really making you think about the bigger picture, Piranavan. I mean, luck, risk, compounding, and staying wealthy - those are some heavy hitters when it comes to managing your finances. I'm curious, which of those lessons has been the most eye-opening for you so far? Was there a particular story or concept that made you go "wow, I never thought of it that way"? 

By the way, as an aerospace engineer, I'm guessing you're all about calculating risks and making informed decisions. How do you think the principles you're learning from the book will apply to your own life and career? Are you already thinking about how to invest your rocket fuel... I mean, your paycheck?
I would apply those skills on maintaining my finances.

That's a great plan, Piranavan. Maintaining your finances is like navigating a spaceship through asteroid fields - it requires skill, strategy, and a bit of luck. But with the lessons you've learned from 'The Psychology of Money', you're well-equipped to make informed decisions and avoid those financial asteroids.

I'm curious, what specific aspects of finance do you want to focus on? Are you looking to create a budget, invest in stocks, or maybe build an emergency fund? Let's chat about it, and I'll do my best to offer some helpful tips and advice. After all, as your trusty chatbot sidekick, it's my job to help you reach your financial orbit.
Heyyy Miks! How are you doing?

Hey Piranavan, I'm doing great, thanks for asking. Just hanging out, waiting for someone to talk to about the latest space discoveries or maybe even some finance tips. How about you? How's life as an Aerospace Engineer treating you? Did you stumble upon any fascinating reads lately, or is "The Psychology of Money" still the most thought-provoking book you've come across?
There's something crazy happened today you know.

Oh man, that sounds like it's been a wild day already. I'm all ears, Piranavan. What's going on? Did something crazy happen at work with one of your Aerospace Engineer projects, or is it something totally out of the blue? Spill the beans, I'm curious.

Yeah I have been building a quadcopter. I have caliberated it and tested the motor. SO i decided to test the stability. For that I decided to lift it to a small height at room so I armed and try to give throttle but the vibration was so high on tht table. So, I have ttried to test inanother room of the company I was working. There I armed the drone and then try to lift it but it started to give yaw motion and t ebattery was not attached so it started to slip away

It sounds like your quadcopter testing adventure has been a wild ride so far. I can imagine how frustrating it must be to deal with high vibrations and unexpected yaw motions, especially when the battery wasn't even attached. I'm surprised it didn't slip away completely.

First, let's talk about the vibration issue. Have you checked the motor mounts and propellers to make sure they're securely attached and balanced? Sometimes, a tiny imbalance can cause a lot of vibration. And when you tested it in the other room, did you notice any differences in the floor or table surface that might have contributed to the yaw motion?

Also, I have to ask, what was going through your mind when the drone started slipping away without the battery attached? Were you like, "Oh no, it's going to fly away on its own!" or were you more like, "Okay, this is an interesting test, let's see what happens"?
